verbs.description: interjoin (third-person singular simple present interjoins, present participle interjoining, simple past and past participle interjoined)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To join mutually; to unite.
examples: […]  it is most probable to be the Port of Trapezonment, plac’d in a Corner of the Euxine Sea; for from this Port, within a few Months, Anno 1272. they came to Ancona, which could not be perform’d from the Caspian Sea, by reason of the great space of Land and Regions interjoin’d.

entries.meaning: To say by way of interruption, to interject.
examples: “No, no,” cried lady Anna, in trepidation, “leave him—let him go.”
Lennard unloosed his hold for a moment; and regarding her ladyship with a look of jealous anger, he stood irresolute.
“Leave him,” interjoined Wentworth. “He has abused the privileges of a social meeting, by venting the preconcerted acumen of a malicious nature; he is beneath your contempt.”
